item.title: A whale deposited 10.19 million USDC into Hyperliquid and shorted WLFI with 3x leverage
item.description: On September 1st, as monitored by Onchain Lens, a whale deposited 10.19 million USDC into Hyperliquid and initiated a WLFI short position with a leverage of 3x. Currently, there are still outstanding orders, and the whale intends to further expand this position.

item.title: Former Cred CEO Sentenced to 52 Months in Prison for $150 Million Cryptocurrency Fraud
item.description: On September 1st, as per the report by Decrypt, a federal judge imposed a combined prison term of nearly eight years on two former executives of the bankrupt crypto lending firm Cred. Their actions resulted in one of the largest investor losses in the history of the crypto industry. Legal experts assert that this ruling establishes a new precedent for holding executives accountable in cases of crypto fraud.The former CEO and co-founder of Cred LLC, Daniel Schatt, was sentenced to 52 months in federal prison, while the company's CFO, Joseph Podulka, was given a 36-month sentence.

item.title: Binance: AIO Trading Now Limited to Sell Orders Only Due to Security Vulnerability in Project Team's Multi-Signature Wallet
item.description: September 1st. As per official information, Binance has declared that, due to user security considerations, AIO trading is currently restricted to sell orders only because the project team's multi-signature wallet has encountered a security vulnerability.

item.title: Quack AI has released the Q Tokenomics, with an airdrop allocation of 12%.
item.description: On September 1st, according to official channels, the AI-driven governance protocol Quack AI announced its Q tokenomics. The total token supply is 10 billion. Among them, 10% is allocated to the core team, 11% to investors and advisors, and 79% to the community and ecosystem. The specific breakdown is as follows: Community - 30%; Ecosystem and Partners - 15%; Airdrop - 12%; Project Treasury - 11%; Marketing and Growth - 6%; Liquidity - 5%. The initial circulating supply of Q is 16.16%.

item.title: Data: WLFI Total On-chain Holdings Surpass $900 Million
item.description: On September 1st, based on Coinglass data, the current total value locked in WLFI contracts has reached $9.02 billion. When calculated in terms of token value, this amounts to a total of 2.8 billion WLFI tokens, with a 22.99% increase in the past 24 hours.

item.title: CMC: The WLFI token supply data may have been adjusted prior to listing. The project team has been contacted for clarification
item.description: On September 1st, CoinMarketCap CEO Rush made a post stating that they have received a large number of user inquiries about the supply of the WLFI token. The previously announced information was based on the latest data provided by the team earlier that day. However, due to the pre-listing allocation of the token, these data points may be subject to adjustments. CoinMarketCap has reached out to the WLFI team for clarification. Since all data is sourced from the project team and verified by them, it will continue to be updated as the situation unfolds.

item.title: WLFI's official multi-signature wallet has transferred 485 million tokens to Jump Crypto for liquidity provision.
item.description: On September 1st, according to on-chain analyst Ai Auntie (@ai_9684xtpa), within the past 10 minutes, the official WLFI multisig has transferred a cumulative total of 485 million LP tokens to two addresses that are under the ownership of Jump Crypto.

item.title: The number of active addresses on #Tron is 2.48M, ranking #1 among all chains.
item.description: The number of active addresses on #Tron is 2.48M, ranking #1 among all chains.

item.title: Hyperliquid Launches LINEA U Perpetual Swap Contract with Up to 3x Leverage
item.description: On September 1st, according to the official website, Hyperliquid has launched the LINEA/USDC perpetual contract, with a maximum leverage of 3x.

item.title: CoinShares: Digital asset investment products saw net inflows of $2.48 billion last week
item.description: On September 1st, CoinShares issued its latest weekly report which indicated that the digital asset market witnessed a capital inflow of $2.48 billion last week. As a result, the total inflow for August reached $4.37 billion. Currently, the year-to-date inflow amounts to $35.5 billion. However, the assets under management (AUM) have decreased by 10% to $219 billion.In the United States, the largest inflow was $2.29 billion. Switzerland, Germany, and Canada also witnessed growth. This suggests that the outflows last Friday were mainly driven by profit-taking.
